sourceNotes: Editorial guidance prepared by Pitchchat; not sourced from user submissions.
title: Chemistry Seed fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: Seed-stage biotech metrics focus on scientific validation and development progress rather than commercial metrics. Investors evaluate data quality, IP position, and team capability. These benchmarks help demonstrate you've de-risked the science enough for institutional investment. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Development Stage
metrics.note: Preclinical or IND-enabling stages most common for seed. Later stage commands premium valuation.

metrics.label: Lead Candidates
metrics.note: Focused pipeline preferred. Lead program should be clearly prioritized with backup compounds.

metrics.label: In-Vivo Data
metrics.note: Animal model data supporting mechanism. Efficacy and preliminary safety signals valuable.

metrics.label: Patents Filed
metrics.note: Composition-of-matter priority. Geographic coverage in key markets (US, EU, Japan, China).

metrics.label: Freedom-to-Operate
metrics.note: FTO analysis identifying potential blocking patents. Clearance strategy if issues identified.

metrics.label: Regulatory Interactions
metrics.note: FDA engagement demonstrates pathway clarity. Type B meeting feedback highly valuable.

metrics.label: CMO Identified
metrics.note: Contract manufacturer identified for scale-up. Process development timeline understood.

metrics.label: Key Opinion Leader Support
metrics.note: KOLs validating science and clinical approach. Active involvement, not just names on website.

metrics.label: Non-Dilutive Funding
metrics.note: SBIR/STTR grants, foundation funding, or pharma collaboration. Extends runway and validates science.

metrics.label: Team Size
metrics.note: Core R&D team with drug development experience. CSO/CMO-caliber leadership.
